intro: Oreopanax santanderianus, commonly known as the Santanderian umbrella tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in compound umbels, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
